html:
Infinity Nikki is getting its version 1.5 update on April 28. The update brings new features, like a Steam client launch and multiplayer.

Below, we explain when Infinity Nikki goes down for maintenance ahead of version 1.5 and when it’ll come back up with the new version using a variety of time zones to help you out.

What time does Infinity Nikki go down for maintenance?

Infinity Nikki will go down for maintenance on Monday, April 28, or Tuesday, April 29 (depending on your time zone), at the following times and will be unavailable for approximately nine hours:

  • April 28 at 10:50 p.m. PDT for the west coast of North America
  • April 28 at 1:50 p.m. EDT for the east coast of North America
  • April 28 at 6:50 p.m. BST for the U.K.
  • April 28 at 7:50 p.m. CEST for western Europe/Paris
  • April 29 at 2:50 a.m. JST for Japan/Tokyo
  • April 29 at 3:50 a.m. AEST for Australia/Sydney

Since the game will be down for quite a few hours, make sure to spend some of your Vital Energy to prevent it from overcapping. Consider waiting on doing some of your weeklies and whatnot, since the new battle pass will start when the game comes back up from maintenance.

What time does Infinity Nikki version 1.5 start?

Infinity Nikki will come back from maintenance with version 1.5 at the following times:

  • April 28 at 8 p.m. PDT for the west coast of North America
  • April 28 at 11 p.m. EDT for the east coast of North America
  • April 29 at 4 a.m. BST for the U.K.
  • April 29 at 5 a.m. CEST for western Europe/Paris
  • April 29 at 12 p.m. JST for Japan/Tokyo
  • April 29 at 1 p.m. AEST for Australia/Sydney

The servers may come up early or late, depending on how maintenance goes, but these are the approximate times the game should come back.

What’s new in Infinity Nikki version 1.5?

In this update, Nikki will go to the “Sea of Stars,” a mysterious place called the “beginning and end of all things.” That being said, you’ll be able to unlock Nikki’s iconic purple starry dress of the same namesake in this version, alongside some other outfits for free. This patch also introduces multiplayer, allowing you to play with your friends.

This patch will also have some interesting new tweaks, like the ability to unlock new colors for your outfits after you glow them up and the ability to dye existing outfits different colors. Most of all, InFold is repeatedly saying that you’ll be able to earn the “equivalent of a total of 100 pulls” in this version, so if you’re strapped for Diamonds, you’ll probably want to play this update.
